page.title: 05Arable Farming & Livestock
page.content: This is an area of mostly arable farms. The main crops are{wheat}and {barley}and{oil seed rape.}Since the closure, a few years ago, of the {British Sugar Corporation Factory}at {Felsted,}little sugar beet is grown. Varieties of wheat are grown for bread and some for biscuits and cakes. Some farmers are experimenting with {durum,}a wheat variety used for pasta. Peas and beans are grown as break crops. {Bovingdon Hall Estate}(pages 3 & 4) is particularly interesting because of the practice of commercial farming and conservation. {Abbots Hall}has a very large intensive pig unit of about 2000 animals and{Sheering Hall}and{Kilhogs {Farm}both have large pig units. {Goldsticks Farm}has about 200 sheep and some farms have some beef cattle.
